**рдЧреБрд░реБ рдмреНрд░рд╣реНрдорд╛ рдЧреБрд░реБ рд╡рд┐рд╖реНрдгреБ, рд╣реИ рдЧреБрд░реБ рд╢реЗрд╖ рдорд╣реЗрд╢ ред
рдХрд╣ рдЯреЗрдКрдБ рдЧреБрд░реБ рд╕реВрд░реНрдп рд╢рд╢рд┐, рд╣реИ рдЧреБрд░реБ рдЧреМрд░реА рдЧрдгреЗрд╢ редред**

Describing the glory of the Guru, Acharya Teoonram Ji explains that when a disciple worships the Guru with full devotion, the Guru manifests in many divine forms: as Brahma to give wisdom, as Vishnu to preserve, as Shiva to destroy ignorance and negativity, as the Sun to illuminate knowledge, as the Moon to bestow cool serenity, and as Gauri and Ganesh to remove all obstacles and pain in the disciple's life.

**рдзреНрдпрд╛рди рдореВрд▓ рдЧреБрд░реБ рдореВрд░рддреА, рдкреВрдЬрд╛ рдореВрд▓ рдЧреБрд░реБ рдкрд╛рджред
рдордВрддреНрд░ рдореВрд▓ рдЧреБрд░реБ рд╡рдЪрди рд╣реИ, рдореБрдХреНрддреНрддрд┐ рдЧреБрд░реБ рдкреНрд░рд╕рд╛рджредред**

For a true seeker, the Guru's divine image is the focus of meditation, His feet are the essence of worship, and His spoken words are the root of all mantras. Such sincere devotion to the Guru leads to liberation by the grace of the Guru тАФ this is the secret path to freedom.

**рдЧреБрд░реБ рднрдХреНрддрд┐ рд╕реЗ рд╣реАрди рдЬреЛ, рдкрдврд╝рддрд╛ рд╡реЗрдж рдкреБрд░рд╛рди ред
рдХрд╣ рдЯреЗрдКрдБ рд╕рд┐рдВрд╣ рд╕рдлрд▓ рдирд╣реАрдВ, рдХрд░реНрдо рдзрд░реНрдо рдЗрд╕реНрдирд╛рди редред**

One who daily recites the Vedas and Puranas, lives a life of righteous action, and performs sacred pilgrimages тАФ yet lacks Guru devotion тАФ all his spiritual practices become fruitless. Acharya Teoonram Ji emphasizes that without devotion and service to the Guru, no ritual or scripture can lead to success or liberation.

**рдХрд╣ рдЯреЗрдКрдБ рд╕рдВрд╕рд╛рд░ рдореЗрдВ, рдЧреБрд░реБ рдЬреИрд╕рд╛ рдирд╣реАрдВ рдореАрддред
рдФрд░ рдорд┐рддреНрд░ рд╕рдм рд╕реНрд╡рд╛рд░реНрдереА, рдмрд┐рди рд╕реНрд╡рд╛рд░реНрде рдЧреБрд░реБ рдиреАрддредред**

Acharya Ji says тАФ in this world, there is no friend like the Guru. Worldly friends often harbor some selfish motive, but the Guru is completely selfless. The Guru acts solely for the upliftment of the disciple's soul, not for any material or personal gain. His friendship is divine and eternal.

**рдЪрд┐рдВрддрд╛рдордгрд┐ рдЧреБрд░реБрджреЗрд╡ рд╣реИ, рддрд╛рдВрдХреЛ рд╕реЗрд╡реЗ рдЬреЛрдпред
рджреБрдЦ рджрд░рд┐рджреНрд░рддрд╛ рджреВрд░ рдХрд░, рд╕реБрдЦ рдкрд╛рд╡реЗ рдЬрди рд╕реЛрдпредред**

The Guru is likened to a divine wish-fulfilling gem (Chintamani). Whoever sincerely serves the Guru is freed from sorrow and poverty, and gains true, lasting happiness. The selfless service to the Guru is the ultimate remedy to all suffering in life.

**рджреАрдкрдХ рд▓реЗ рдЧреБрд░реБ рдЬреНрдЮрд╛рди рдХрд╛, рдЕрд╡рд┐рджреНрдпрд╛ рддрдо рдХрд░ рджреВрд░ред
рдХрд╣ рдЯреЗрдКрдБ рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпрдХреНрд╖ рд▓рдЦреЛ, рдЬреЛ рд╕рдм рдШрдЯ рднрд░рдкреВрд░редред**

Guru gives the lamp of knowledge that removes the darkness of ignorance. Acharya Ji says тАФ this transformation can be directly experienced. The Guru's light fills every being. One who embraces the Guru's wisdom begins to see divine clarity within and around.

**рдмреНрд░рд╣реНрдо рдирд┐рд╖реНрда рдмреНрд░рд╣реНрдо рд╢реНрд░реЛрддреНрд░реА, рд╕рджрд╛рдЪрд╛рд░ рдпреБрдд рд╣реЛрдпред
рдХрд╣ рдЯреЗрдКрдБ рд╢рд┐рд╖реНрдп рд╣рд┐рдд рдЪрд╣реЗ, рд╕рддреНрдЧреБрд░реБ рдХрд╣рд┐рдпреЗ рд╕реЛрдпредред**

A true Satguru is one who is firmly established in Brahman, knowledgeable in scriptures, lives virtuously, and has unwavering concern for the disciple's well-being. Only such a spiritually elevated and compassionate master is worthy of being called a Satguru.

**рд░рд╛рдЧ рджреНрд╡реЗрд╖ рдЬрд┐рд╕рдХреЛ рдирд╣реАрдВ, рдХрд╛рдо рдХреНрд░реЛрдз рдЕрд╣рдВрдХрд╛рд░ред
рд╕рддрдЧреБрд░реБ рд╕реЛ рдкрд╣рдЪрд╛рдирд┐рдпреЗ, рдХрд╣ рдЯреЗрдКрдБ рдирд┐рд░реНрдзрд╛рд░редред**

One who is free from attachment, hatred, desire, anger, and ego тАФ recognize him as the true Satguru. Acharya Ji affirms тАФ the true Guru remains unattached, serene, and divine in every action and word.

**рдХреНрдпрд╛ рдЧреГрд╣реА рдкреБрдирд┐ рд╡рд┐рд░рдХреНрдд рдХреНрдпрд╛, рдмреНрд░рд╣рд╛рдЬреНрдЮрд╛рди рдЬрд┐рд╣реЗрдВ рд╣реЛрдпред
рдХрд╣ рдЯреЗрдКрдБ рд╕рддреН рдмреЛрдз рджреЗ, рд╕рддреНрдЧреБрд░реБ рдХрд╣рд┐рдпреЗ рд╕реЛрдпредред**

Whether a householder or a renunciate тАФ if one possesses divine wisdom and can awaken the disciple to the truth, Acharya Ji says тАФ such a person should be regarded as a Satguru. What matters is realization, not external status.

**рд╕реБрд░рддрд┐ рд▓рдЧреЗ рдЧреБрд░реБ рд╢рдмреНрдж рдЬрд┐рд╕, рдорди рдЧреБрд░реБ рдореВрд░рдд рдорд╛рд╣рд┐рдВред

**рд╕рддреНрд╕рдВрдЧ рд╕реЗ рд╕рддреНрдЧреБрд░реВ рдорд┐рд▓реЗ, рд╕рддреНрдЧреБрд░реВ рд╕реЗ рдирд┐рдЬ рдЬреНрдЮрд╛рди !

God rewards actions with corresponding fruits, but the Guru bestows liberation itself. Hence, Acharya Ji says тАФ the Guru is even greater than God in terms of spiritual grace.

Without the Guru, there can be no true devotion, no real wisdom, and no spiritual fulfillment. Acharya Ji declares тАФ liberation is impossible without the grace of the Satguru.

One who receives complete guidance from the perfect Guru and remembers Him with sincerity тАФ Acharya Ji says тАФ such a soul attains the supreme, eternal realm of liberation.

chetichand.title: The Deity of the Sindhi Community, Lord Varunavatar Shri Jhulelal
chetichand.author: monu_ram_sai_ji
chetichand.article:
According to tradition, numerous festivals, celebrations, and religious occasions are observed with great enthusiasm across India. Every festival has a historical or mythological background that defines its significance. Different communities celebrate their respective festivals with devotion, faith, and excitement. Similarly, the Sindhi community has a major festival called Cheti Chand, which is celebrated with immense joy, devotion, and reverence worldwide.

The deity of this festival is Lord Varunavatar Shri Jhulelal, who is also known as Jind Pir, Lal Sai, Amar Lal, and Udero Lal.

Cheti Chand marks the auspicious beginning of the Vikram Samvat (Hindu New Year). 'Cheti' refers to the month of Chaitra (the start of the new Samvat year), and 'Chand' signifies the lunar date. On this day, the Sindhi community worships Lord Jhulelal in his divine form, offering prayers and expressing their faith with devotion. People joyfully chant 'Aayo Lal, Jhulelal' and greet each other with wishes for Jhulelal Jayanti and the New Year. Devotees light lamps, perform rituals for Baharana Sahib, and celebrate with traditional Sindhi folk dances like Dodiya and Matka dance to honor the birth of Lord Jhulelal. It is also essential to understand the historical significance of this grand Cheti Chand festival.

As mentioned in the Bhagavad Gita:

'Yada yada hi dharmasya glanir bhavati bharata,
Abhyutthanam adharmasya tadatmanam srijamyaham.
Paritranaya sadhunam vinashaya cha dushkritam,
Dharma samsthapanarthaya sambhavami yuge yuge.'

(Translation: 'Whenever righteousness declines and unrighteousness rises, I manifest myself to protect the virtuous, destroy evil, and re-establish dharma.')

During the reign of the tyrannical ruler Mirak Shah in the city of Thatta (Sindh province), Hindus faced extreme oppression. The ruler attempted to forcibly convert them to Islam, believing it would secure him a place in paradise. He declared that those who refused to convert would face severe punishment. As a result, Hindus were subjected to extreme persecution, including the forced cutting of their sacred hair (shikha) and the removal of their sacred thread (janeu). There was an effort to destroy their religious identity and assimilate them into a different faith.

The scriptures teach that one should never abandon their religion. The Bhagavad Gita and the revered Sindhi saint Swami Teoonram Maharaj emphasize:

'Dharm apne mahi har dam pyaar kar natna nahi.
Sees jave, jaan de par, dharm se hatna nahi.'

(Translation: 'Always love your religion, never abandon it.
Even if you have to sacrifice your life, do not deviate from your faith.')

In distress, the persecuted Hindus turned to the sacred banks of the Sindhu River and prayed to Lord Varuna for three days with unwavering devotion.

'Bhakton ke vash mein rahe, keh Teoon Bhagwan.
Yog kshem tanka kare, sukh sampati maan.'

(Translation: 'The Lord is bound by the devotion of his devotees,
He takes care of their well-being and blesses them with happiness and prosperity.')

Hearing their prayers, divine intervention occurred. A celestial voice reassured the Hindus, saying, 'Do not fear! Mirak Shah will not harm you. I shall soon be born in Nasarpur at the house of my devotee Ratanrai, through the womb of Mother Devaki.'

Overjoyed by the divine prophecy, the Hindus returned home. As foretold, in Vikram Samvat 1007, on a Friday evening in the month of Chaitra, the Supreme Lord incarnated as a beautiful child named Udaychand in the house of Ratanrai and Devaki. Upon hearing of this divine birth, the people of Sindh rejoiced, and even the heavens showered flowers in celebration. As Udaychand grew, his miraculous deeds became widely known throughout Sindh.

Eventually, news of this divine child reached Mirak Shah, who began experiencing terrifying dreams. The Hindus believed that Lord Jhulelal himself had come to protect them. As the divine child grew, his supernatural acts became more apparent, instilling fear in Mirak Shah, who ultimately surrendered to JhulelalтАЩs divine presence.

Lord Jhulelal then explained to the ruler that the entire creation belongs to the Almighty. Hindus and Muslims are one; what Muslims call Allah, Hindus call Ishwar. The ultimate goal remains the same for all. Enlightened by these teachings, Mirak Shah accepted the truth, and righteousness triumphed over injustice.

Lord Jhulelal performed numerous divine acts and imparted spiritual wisdom to uplift mankind. He safeguarded Hindu Dharma and upheld the banner of Sanatan Dharma. In Vikram Samvat 1020, on the auspicious day of Bhadrapada Shukla Chaturdashi, Lord Jhulelal took Jal Samadhi (water immersion) and merged into the divine realm.

The legacy of Sindhi valor and culture has existed since ancient times. The Indus Valley Civilization, with its remarkable artifacts unearthed in Mohenjo-Daro and Harappa, testifies to the antiquity of Sindhi heritage. The Sindhu River, mentioned in the Vedas, is considered the most ancient river. Even the Ramayana and Mahabharata contain multiple references to Sindh. The Indian national anthem also acknowledges SindhтАЩs significance: 'Punjab, Sindh, Gujarat, MarathaтАж.' The name 'Hind' is derived from 'Sindh,' highlighting its historical importance in Hindu scriptures like the Bhagavata Purana, Ramayana, and Mahabharata.

Several great saints and sages were born on the sacred banks of the Sindhu River, including Lord Jhulelal, Swami Asuram Maharaj, Swami Lilashah, Bhagat Kanwarram, Sai Vasanshah, and Acharya Teoonram Maharaj of the Prem Prakash Panth. The ancient Sindhu civilization and Sanatan culture continue to thrive, preserving the rich Sindhi heritage. To honor this glorious tradition, the Sindhi community celebrates Cheti Chand annually as Jhulelal Jayanti and Sindhiyat Day.

chetichand-sandesh.title: Why Did Lord Shri Jhulelal Incarnate..? - Awakening Message (Thought-Provoking)
chetichand-sandesh.author: monu_ram_sai_ji
chetichand-sandesh.article:
Like every year, the grand festival of the Sindhi community, **Chetichand**, has arrived! Enthusiastic preparations across IndiaтАФvarious cultural and religious programs within Chetichand celebrations!

Have you ever wondered? Why do we celebrate the birth anniversary or festival of our deity? What was the reason behind His incarnation? Think about it! Just by celebrating these festivals, will we please the Lord? Are we truly following the faith for which He incarnated?

Every person knows that one should adhere to their religion! One should follow religious values and traditions! But why donтАЩt they? Because they donтАЩt truly love their faith and community! They organize grand events merely for show! They celebrate festivals, but they donтАЩt make an effort to understand their history and significance!

**The revered Satguru Swami Haridasram Ji Maharaj** always emphasized one question during Chetichand Mahotsav: Why did Lord Shri Jhulelal incarnate? The common response wasтАФto protect Hindu faith and traditions! But what is Hindu Dharma? The sacred symbols of HinduismтАФ**Shikha (topknot) and Janeu (sacred thread)**тАФsignify religious identity. So, Lord Jhulelal incarnated to protect Hinduism, which means to safeguard the Shikha and Janeu!

Back then, tyrant Mirkhshah was forcefully converting Hindus. But today, who is oppressing us? Who is cutting off our Shikha and Janeu? Reflect upon this! If we cannot even protect our own faith, what is the point of celebrating festivals? What is the truth? Think!

Looking at history, we find that **Varunavatar Lord Shri Jhulelal** incarnated to protect Hinduism. Non-believers were persecuting Hindus, forcing them to abandon their faith by removing their sacred symbols. Our religion was under threat! In distress, Hindus cried out for divine interventionтАФ'O Lord, protect us! Save our Dharma!' In response, **Lord Shri Jhulelal Sai Ji** incarnated to restore faith and prevent Hindus from being forced into other religions. Just as the **Bhagavad Gita** states:

**'Swadharme nidhanam shreyah, paradharmo bhayavahah.'**

(Dying in one's own faith is beneficial; following anotherтАЩs faith is fearful.)

Just as water is life for a fish, faith is life for a human! Therefore, one must always stay firm in their religion! Now, ask yourselfтАФAre we truly following our faith? Have we Hindus maintained the traditions of Janeu and Shikha? No! Then, arenтАЩt we dishonoring our deity? How can we protect our faith if we donтАЩt even uphold the principles for which Lord Jhulelal incarnated?

Previously, others oppressed us and drove us away from our faith. But today, **we are free yet enslaved!** We are harming ourselves, making ourselves weak, and distancing ourselves from our own religion! ItтАЩs time to wake up! Hindus must take the initiative to wear Shikha and Janeu once again!!!

**Satguru Swami Teoonram Ji Maharaj** has written in his divine words:

**'Dharma apne maahin hardam, pyaar kar natna nahi!
Sees jaave jaan de, par dharma se hatna nahi!!'**

(Surrender your life if needed, but never abandon your faith!)

Many saints, sages, and warriors sacrificed their lives to protect Dharma! Even the Supreme Divine Incarnations had to manifest repeatedly in India to safeguard religion! Therefore, no matter how many hardships one endures, one must always remain steadfast in their faith! One must always consider their own religion as superior!

Hence, awaken Hindu brothers for the protection of Dharma! Protect **Sanatan Dharma** first within yourself! Preserve your faith by wearing **Shikha and Janeu**! Adopt it yourself and inspire others to do the same! Only then will our Dharma survive, and we will truly please our Lord! Only then will our **ChetichandтАФLord Shri Jhulelal Jayanti** celebration be meaningful and successful!
